ross-milne.name: Ross Milne
ross-milne.bio: Ross Milne is a type designer and founding member of the design studio Working Format. He completed his postgraduate studies at the Type & Media program at the KABK in The Hauge, Netherlands, and has gone onto regularly work with Typotheque there, and Commercial Type in New York. He currently teaches type design at Emily Carr University.

24.title: When is a typeface done? The process of development of Charlie & Echo
24.abstract: For now, Ross Milne’s new typefaces Charlie & Echo are done. Recently release through the Typotheque, with support for over 140 languages across Latin, Cyrillic and Greek scripts, eleven weights with corresponding italics, numerous figure styles, expanded icons, arrows and too many currency symbols to count, it’s fair to say that Charlie has grown bigger than ever envisioned. He’ll share some of the process in getting to that point at Type Brigade №24.

emma-metcalfe-hurst-and-ingrid-olauson.name: Emma Metcalfe Hurst & Ingrid Olauson
emma-metcalfe-hurst-and-ingrid-olauson.bio: Emma Metcalfe Hurst and Ingrid Olauson are BFA candidates at Emily Carr University in Critical and Cultural Practices. Olauson is a writer from Vancouver, BC whose criticism and poetry has been a platform for collaborative works with other artists. Olauson is a writer from Vancouver, BC whose criticism and poetry has been a platform for collaborative works with other artists. Metcalfe Hurst is an artist, writer, the assistant curator at Access Gallery, and a member of the artist-run AVENUE gallery.

24.title: Cult Typography: The Harlequin Romance as Critical Aesthetic
24.abstract: Looking back historically at type as a form of branding and voice, the cult typography of the Harlequin Romance novel will be revived in conversation. Topics such as myth, desire, fantasy and projection will serve as a basis to reflect on the collaborative and research based project Ingrid and Emma undertook for their photo and text based Harlequin Novel project Paradise Passes Through Here. By mimicking the poetic affectiveness of the pulp aesthetic, a connection will be drawn in relation to the politics of Feminist discourse and it's recognition in conceptual art.

peter-cocking.name: Peter Cocking
peter-cocking.bio: Peter Cocking is one of Canada’s most celebrated book designers. He’s spoken on typography and design across the US & Canada, from Pecha Kucha Vancouver to the Type Directors Club in New York. Our first talk of the evening will see him introduce and explore the typographic thinking behind the exhibition.

23.title: Introducing the The Pop-Up Museum of Typography

comd-404.name: Advance Typography class
comd-404.bio: In place of a second talk, we’ll have many. The Advanced Typography class will each give a two-minute lightning talks on a variety of typography work they’ve completed this semester. You’ll be able to tour the exhibition before we start and after the talks.

jenny-chow.name: Jenny Chow
jenny-chow.bio: Jenny Chow is a registered architect in Vancouver, but her work is decidedly international. She has completed projects in Germany, Ireland, and Austria, in addition to the Alessi flagship store in New York City, and the winning design of the China Insurance Group Tower in Shenzhen, China. Previously, she worked in New York and Vienna, holds a Masters in Architecture and Bachelor in Environmental Design Studies from Dalhousie University in Halifax, and is now focused on the construction of Vancouver House as part of Dialog.

faculty.name: Alvin Kwan & Vince Lo
faculty.bio: Faculty is a studio founded by designers Alvin Kwan and Vince Lo. They focus on communication in various mediums—screen, print, and more—and value presentation with clarity, honesty, and sincerity. Their work has been recognised by Applied Arts, the Adobe Design Achievement Awards, HOW, and the GDC. Before this? They established Practice Type to house their initial foray into type design, which included the Chinese and Latin face Collator.

celeste-martin.name: Celeste Martin
celeste-martin.bio: Celeste Martin is an Assistant Professor at Emily Carr University of Art + Design. She has a background in communication design, and specialises in typography, researches at the university’s Social Interactive Media Centre, and is the editor of the award-winning design research journal Current

20.title: Dynamic typography in digital publication design

neil-kandalgaonkar.name: Neil Kandalgaonkar
neil-kandalgaonkar.bio: “Sometimes, when a typeface I like becomes popular, I want to say ‘I loved you first.’” Neil Kandalgaonkar helped make that thing you like on the Internet. Google, Upcoming, Flickr, Wikipedia. Before that, he designed type.

20.title: Undesigning Cherokee syllabary: Restoring the usability of a Native American writing system

0.title: This is my talk
